item.title: Rick add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Men of Athens, I honor and love you; but I shall obey God rather than you, and while I have life and strength I shall never cease from the practice and teaching of philosophy... Understand that I shall never alter my ways, not even if I have to die many times." -- Plato

item.title: Rick add a quote by Chuang Tzu
item.description: "Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education." -- Chuang Tzu

item.title: Rick add a quote by Chuang Tzu
item.description: "Happiness is the abscence of the striving for happiness." -- Chuang Tzu

item.title: Rick add a quote by Deng Ming-Dao
item.description: "The moon does not fight. It attacks no one. It does not worry. It does not try to crush others. It keeps to its course, but by its very nature, it gently influences. What other body could pull an entire ocean from shore to shore? The moon is faithful to its nature and its power is never diminished." -- Deng Ming-Dao

item.title: Rick add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Doing nothing is better than being busy doing nothing." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Rick add a quote by Vaclav Havel
item.description: "The salvation of this human world lies nowhere else than in the human heart, in the human power to reflect, in human meekness and human responsibility." -- Vaclav Havel

item.title: Rick add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "all streams flow to the sea because it is lower than they are. humility gives it its power. if you want to govern the people, you must place yourself below them. if you want to lead the people, you must learn how to follow them." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Rick add a quote by Guillaume Apollinaire
item.description: "Come to the edge," he said. They said, "We are afraid." Come to the edge," he said. They came. He pushed them...and they flew." -- Guillaume Apollinaire

item.title: Rick add a quote by Guillaume Apollinaire
item.description: "Now and then it's good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy." -- Guillaume Apollinaire

item.title: Rick add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Rick add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "To bear and not to own; to act and not lay claim; to do the work and let it go: for just letting it go is what makes it stay." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Rick add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Fill your bowl to the brim and it will spill. Keep sharpening your knife and it will blunt." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Rick add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "He is free from self- display, and therefore he shines;" -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Rick add a quote by Miyamoto Musashi
item.description: "Think lightly of yourself and deeply of the world" -- Miyamoto Musashi

item.title: Rick add a quote by Jarod Kintz
item.description: "To Do Today, 1/17/08 1. Sit and think 2. Reach enlightenment 3. Feed the cats" -- Jarod Kintz

item.title: Rick add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Rick add a quote by Seamus Heaney
item.description: "If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way." -- Seamus Heaney

item.title: Rick add a quote by Fromentin
item.description: "Art is the expression of the invisible by means of the visible." -- Fromentin

item.title: Rick add a quote by Kishore Bansal
item.description: "Aesthetical expression of calmness and contentment glow on our face after burning ego into ashes" -- Kishore Bansal
